description: Installation of replacement windows and stairwell fire doors to the south-eastern and north-western elevations of Binley House, Charcot House, Denmead House, Dunbridge House and Winchfield House.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.
Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved drawings and specifications, unless approved otherwise in writing by the local planning authority, listed as follows: Cover letter dated 08/02/2022 by Lawson Queay; Design and Access Statement (February 2022) by Lawson Queay; Feasibility Study Report (December 2017) by Keegans; Heritage Impact Assessment (March 2023) by HCUK Group; Planning Statement (February 2023) by RE Planning; Location plan; 214265/01-01 (Existing Window Details); 214265/01-02 (Existing Window Arrangement (Floors 1&2)); 214265/01-03 Rev. A (Existing Window Arrangements (Floors 3-5)); 214265/01-04 (Existing Front Elevation 1-75 Binley House, 1-75 Charcot House, 1-75 Denmead House, 1-75 Dunbridge House, 1-75 Winchfield House); 214265/01-05 (Existing Rear Elevation 1-75 Binley House, 1-75 Charcot House, 1-75 Denmead House, 1-75 Dunbridge House, 1-75 Winchfield House); 214265/01-06 (Existing Stairwell Doors); 214265/02-01 (Proposed Window Types (Right Hand Side Flats)); 214265/02-02 (Proposed Window Types (Left Hand Side Flats)); 214265/02-03 (Proposed Window Arrangements (Floors 1&2); 214265/02-04 (Proposed Window Arrangements (Floors 3-5); 214265/02-05 (Proposed Front Elevation 1-75 Binley House, 1-75 Charcot House, 1-75 Denmead House, 1-75 Dunbridge House, 1-75 Winchfield House); 214265/02-06 (Proposed Rear Elevation 1-75 Binley House, 1-75 Charcot House, 1-75 Denmead House, 1-75 Dunbridge House, 1-75 Winchfield House); 214265/02-05 Rev. A (Proposed Front Elevation 1-75 Binley House, 1-75 Charcot House, 1-75 Denmead House, 1-75 Dunbridge House, 1-75 Winchfield House); 214265/02-06 Rev. A (Proposed Rear Elevation 1-75 Binley House, 1-75 Charcot House, 1-75 Denmead House, 1-75 Dunbridge House, 1-75 Winchfield House); ALTON_F_07 Rev. D (Lawson Queay - Alton F - 92mm Stormproof Casement Window - Window Type B Kitchen (All Floors)); ALTON_F_08 Rev. B (Lawson Queay - Alton F - 92mm Stormproof Casement Window & 68mm Door - Window Type
Condition : 3 - Notwithstanding what is shown on the approved drawings, samples of the proposed details and materials shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority before works commence. Such details shall include:
a) the finish to the paintwork of all window and door units; 
b) the glass type to the lower panel of window types A and C; 
c) the colour of the external face of the trickle vents; and
d) final details of the external and communal ironmongery, such as window handles and kickplates.
Reason: To ensure a high quality of development, limit harm to designated heritage assets and to accord with policies LP1, LP2, and LP3 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
